body:
Hmmm interesting. This kind of issues usually isn't Video2X's problem, so I'm guessing it might be your video player.
Does the same issue exist on VLC?
Sorry, it was actually 4.6.0 (with waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan). And the issue continues while playing the video on other players. I tested mpv, MPC-HC, Movies and TV and Windows Media Player.

I tried anime4k with v4.5.0. I even mentioned the artifacts on the other post, but I thought it was anime4k's problem.

> Standard waifu2x and anime4k are working - but anime4k had a lot of artifacts.

Edit: I didn't wait for waifu2x to finish, so I don't know if it would end with artifacts or not.

Could you please send me the original video?
I'll test it out in my environment and see what's wrong.
looks like encoding or decoding problemï¼Œmaybe try another encoder or decoder of ffmpeg.

> Could you please send me the original video?
> I'll test it out in my environment and see what's wrong.

Here is it: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YTW2moO1u_cgZKkiq51gTjJK-jZ-Td4v/view?usp=sharing
Yes I am, I've been unable to reproduce the problems and I'm hung up on something else right now.

No problem, I just found weird that you were not responding, but I should have checked your twitter or gitmemory before. "I've been unable to reproduce the problems" About this, I can try to upscale the same video again, to see if it will happen.
Feels more like a decoding problem.
Do you have any idea how to solve it?

Actually, could you please send me the output video?
I'll take a look at what's wrong with it.
Was a solution found? I am running into artifacts as well.
Well the first thing I'd suggest you to try is to use software decoding. Some players have problems hardware-decode large video files and produce artifacts.

> Well the first thing I'd suggest you to try is to use software decoding. Some players have problems hardware-decode large video files and produce artifacts.

Thank you! Wow, after upscaling for 152 hours I feared the results were a loss. You are a hero!!
I think this might be the solution for the initial post too. I'm closing it for now. Feel free to comment and reopen.
